715343f-a.title: Manhattan: 125th Street - 1st Avenue
715343f-a.text:
333-327 East 125th Street, north side, between First and Second Avenues. The centre building, 331, is a threeestory frame house. These three buildings, along with the entire block, will be demolished by 1934, to make way for the approach to the Tri-Borough
Bridge.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 259.

715347f-b.title: Manhattan: 125th Street - 1st Avenue
715347f-b.text:
(1)
East 125th Street, north side, west from First to Second Aves., showing the raised viaduct for the westbound traffic of the TTriborough Bridge. On the right, and under the raised roadway, to the aforementioned bridge, is the approach to the Willis Ave. Bridge to the Bronx.
May 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view from the same point of vantage as No. 1, and showing the eastbound (to Oueens) viaduct that is on the south side or East 125th Street. On the extreme right, appears the 125th Street station of the
Second Ave. Elevated Line.
May 7, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
